english: The class started at ten.

english: If I have time, I'll come.

english: "Valse de la Lune" was composed by Yoko Kanno.

english: I ate so many mandarins that my hands were stained yellow.

english: How do fish survive in water?

english: Our second daughter Momoko is good-natured, but she isn't very good at studying. It's only a small thing but it causes worry.

english: My oldest daughter's name is Chizuru.

japanese: この車はディーゼル車です。
english: This car has a diesel engine.

japanese: お忙しい中、お呼び立てしてすみませんでした。
english: I am sorry to have called you out of your busy schedule.

english: The example sentence was splendid, wasn't it?

japanese: トムがポップコーンを食べたんだよ。
english: Tom ate popcorn.

english: Humans are odd. I'd much rather be a cartoon fox.

japanese: 中途半端なことはしないで欲しい。
english: I don't want you to do things halfway.

english: As the proverb says, time is money.

japanese: こずえちゃんを誘って、喫茶店で一緒にコーヒーを飲んでケーキも食べたのよ。
english: I invited over Kozue, we had coffee and cake at the coffee shop together.

english: That's what the doctor said.

english: A mixture of snow and rain was falling from the sky.

english: In addition the snow thaw is near.

english: Powdered snow is hard to melt and piles up easily.

japanese: 牡丹雪は、とけやすく積もりにくい。
english: Thick snowflakes melt easily and accumulate slowly.

japanese: トムってさ、ユーチューバーだよ。
english: Tom is a YouTuber.

japanese: メアリーって、ユーチューバーなのよ。

english: We're all married women.

english: Turn on the light!

english: I'm more worried about you than about the future of Japan.

english: That's what Tom wanted to say.

japanese: トムはそれが言いたかったんだ。
english: That's what Tom wanted to say.

english: There are only twenty pages left until I finish reading the book.

japanese: それが整ったら、このメール送るように彼に頼んどいて。
english: Ask him to send this e-mail when it's ready.

english: Everyone found out he was lying.

japanese: コンパクトで持ち運びやすい辞書が要りそうだな。
english: A dictionary that is compact and easy to carry around seems to be required.

japanese: コンパクトで携帯しやすい辞書がいるな。
english: I really need an easy to carry dictionary that's compact.

japanese: 新婦のお父さんね、結婚式に遅れてきたのよ。
english: The bride's father arrived late to the wedding.

japanese: 香水売り場の匂いはきつ過ぎます。
english: The smell in a perfumery is too strong.

japanese: 心理学を勉強すればするほど面白いと思えてきたんだ。
english: The more I studied psychology, the more interesting it seemed to me.

japanese: 私たち、試験で「A」を取ったのよ。
english: We got A's on the exam.

english: I had a dream last night that an okapi and I built a hanging church on the face of a cliff.

english: I'll be there until seven.

japanese: そこに７時までいるよ。

japanese: 昨夜の地震はかなり大きかったよ。
english: Last night's earthquake was very strong.

japanese: オーストラリアでは、よく地震があるの？

english: I can't stop until he tells me to.

japanese: とあるサイトによれば、糖質制限ダイエットは効果があるそうだ。
english: According to one website, low carb diets do work.

english: We're both thirteen years old.

japanese: 私たち二人とも13歳です。
english: We're both thirteen years old.

english: My bicycle is newer than yours.

japanese: この車、買ったばかりだからまだ土禁なの。悪いけど靴脱いでくれる？
english: I just bought this car recently so I have a no shoes rule. I'm sorry but could you take off your shoes?

japanese: ここから先は、土足禁止です。
english: From this point outdoor footwear is prohibited.

english: This is my phone number.

english: You don't have the right to sell my stuff.

english: Thank you very much for your cooperation.

english: I've been learning Esperanto since six months ago, but I can understand it more than I can speak it.

japanese: 半年前からエスペラント語を勉強してるんだけど、話すよりかは理解できてるよ。
english: I've been learning Esperanto since six months ago, but I can understand it more than I can speak it.

japanese: これは、すぐに治りますよ。
english: This will heal soon.

japanese: トムって、いつまで寝るつもりかな。

english: You don't need to pay anything. Today, dinner is on me.

japanese: 出さなくていいわよ。今日のディナーは、私のおごりよ。
english: You don't need to pay anything. Today, dinner is on me.

english: Tom came back as if nothing had happened.

english: Do you speak Sinhalese?

english: Can you stop standing behind me and looking at my hair whorl?

english: I read three books a week.

english: I read three books a week.

english: Kyoko has mail notifications turned off and last updated on the 25th January 2016.

japanese: トムね、両親ともめてるの。

english: "How do you like the picture?" "I think it's beautiful."

english: We're Canadians, and we love our country.

japanese: 僕らはカナダ人で、祖国が大好きです。

english: Humans are silly.

japanese: 「あなた、可愛いわね」「そんなことないわ。あなたの方こそ可愛いわ」「そんなことないよ。あなたが可愛い！」「いいえ。可愛いのはあなたよ！」「わかった。可愛いのは、わたし」
english: "You're cute." "No, you're cute." "No, you're cute!" "No, you're cute!" "OK, I'm cute."

japanese: 「はい」か「いいえ」でお答えください。
english: Please answer yes or no.

japanese: 「Yes」か「No」でお答えください。
english: Please answer yes or no.

english: We passed the exam.

japanese: 私は彼の健康が心配です。
english: I'm worried about his health.

japanese: 貯金箱がスッカラカンでひもじい。
english: The savings are completely exhausted.

english: It's foggy outside.

english: "My stomach hurts." "How come? Did you eat something strange?" "No idea."

english: It's been raining for a while now. I wonder if somebody's heart is crying.

japanese: トムってここに来る前に何か食べたのかもしれないね。
english: Tom might've eaten something before he got here.

english: What happened to the bag of potato chips that was here?

japanese: ここに置いてたポテトチップスはどうしたの？

japanese: ２人ともオーストラリア出身だよ。
english: They are both from Australia.

english: "Do you know where the cake I put in the fridge is?" "Ah, it's in my belly."

japanese: 「あっ、財布にお金入れてくるの忘れたかも」「なぬっ」「まぁ、カードがあるし......。あっ、財布がない。財布、持ってくるの忘れたかも。まぁ、大丈夫かぁ」「はじめから、人の財布を当てにしてただろう？」「違う。違う。本当に忘れたんだって」
english: "I think I forgot to put money in my wallet." "Huh?" "I still have my cards, though...Ah, I don't have my wallet. I must've forgot it. Oh well." "You meant to leech from the start, didn't you?" "No, no, I actually forgot it."

japanese: 財布の中にお金が入ってないの。
english: I don't have any money in my wallet.

japanese: お財布にお金がないわ。
english: I don't have any money in my wallet.

japanese: 「ねぇ、これ見て。便利そうじゃない？」「そうだね。買ってみたら？」「私、財布持ってないんだ」「じゃ、諦めなさい」
english: "Hey, look at this. This seems useful, doesn't it?" "Yeah. How about we buy it?" "I didn't bring my wallet." "Oh well."

japanese: 郵便局の近くに住んでます。
english: We live near the post office.

japanese: トムね、体重を落としたいんだって。
english: Tom says that he wants to lose weight.

english: Hey, did you know? The normal "fluffy bread" eaten in Japan is rare in Australia.

japanese: 夜中にポテチなんか食べたら、太るよ。
english: If you eat stuff like potato chips in the middle of the night, you'll get fat.

japanese: 冷たい物ばかり飲んでたら、お腹壊すよ。
english: If you drink too many cold beverages you'll get an upset stomach.

english: I usually put honey in my tea instead of sugar.

japanese: 俺のサングラスはお前のより新しいよ。
english: My sunglasses are newer than yours.

english: These sunglasses are the latest model.

english: I'm fine with standard model sunglasses.

japanese: このサングラスは、今年の限定モデルになります。
english: These sunglasses are from this year's limited edition.

japanese: もし世界のどこにでも住めるとしたら、どこに住む？
english: If you could live anywhere in the world, where would you live?

japanese: 世界中どこにでも住めるとしたら、どこに住む？
english: If you could live anywhere in the world, where would you live?

english: Even though you are recovering from an illness, you mustn't eat foods like cup ramen.

japanese: 「えっと」とか「あの」とか、ついつい口癖で言っちゃうんだよな。
english: I make a habit of saying "Umm" and "Uhh" a lot.

japanese: １日がもっと長ければいいのになぁ。
english: I wish there were more hours in a day.

japanese: 日本の国会は、第８２代首相に橋本龍太郎氏を指名した。

japanese: 内閣総理大臣指名選挙が行われ、第８２代内閣総理大臣に橋本龍太郎氏が選出されました。
english: A vote was held by the National Diet, and Ryutaro Hashimoto was selected to be the 82nd prime minister.

japanese: 私の方が認識不足だったかもしれません。あゆみさんに失礼なことを言ってしまった上の文は、撤回します。
english: Perhaps I didn't yet understand fully. I take back the rude remark I made to Ayumi.

japanese: 私は図書館で面白い本を読みました。
english: I read an interesting book at the library.

japanese: 私、変な臭いする？
english: Do I smell funny?

japanese: この薬は、どれくらいの間隔で飲めばいいんですか？
english: How often should I take this medicine?

japanese: あなたが行かないんなら、私も行かない。
english: If you're not going, I'm not either.

japanese: 早寝は嫌いなんだ。
english: I don't like going to bed early.

japanese: 心配すんなって。俺が言うから。
english: Don't worry. I'll tell him.

japanese: 文の下に書いた自分のコメントは消したよ。
english: I deleted the comment I had made under the sentence.

japanese: じゃぁ、行くのはよしとこう。
english: Well, let's give up going.

japanese: トムもメアリーもふたりとも学校が大っ嫌いだったのよ。
english: Both Tom and Mary hated school.

japanese: トムもメアリーも両方とも学校が大っ嫌いなのよ。
english: Both Mary and Tom despise school.

japanese: 昨日家にいればよかったなぁ。
english: I wish I'd stayed at home yesterday.

japanese: トムはメアリーからの手紙を全て燃やしてしまった。
english: Tom burned all of the letters that Mary sent him.

japanese: 俺たち、トムなんかよりずっと若いよ。
english: We're a lot younger than Tom.

japanese: 私たちは、トムさんよりかなり若いのよ。
english: We're a lot younger than Tom.

japanese: タイミングって、大切だよね。
english: You know timing is important, right?

japanese: トムがフランス語を話してるところって、実際に見たことある？
english: Have you ever actually seen Tom speak French?

japanese: 醜い猫が私の椅子に座ったんだよ！
english: An ugly cat sat in my chair!

japanese: ここって、冬になるとよく雪が降るんですか？
english: Does it snow here often in winter?

japanese: トムもメアリーも両方ともお金持ちになったよ。
english: Tom and Mary both got rich.

japanese: これは誰の机ですか？
english: Whose desk is this?

japanese: メアリーの冗談は、僕には理解できなかった。
english: I didn't get Mary's joke.

japanese: 綺麗な家なんだけどね。問題は、狭いのよ。
english: It's a beautiful house. The problem is that it's tiny.

japanese: 素敵な家なんだけどね。問題は、ちっちゃいの。
english: It's a beautiful house. The problem is that it's tiny.

japanese: ここって、３年前に泊まったのと同じホテルだね。
english: This is the same hotel I stayed in three years ago.

japanese: 「トム、お家建てたんだってね」「あっ、はい。『うさぎ小屋』ですけど」「またまた、謙遜しちゃって」
english: "Tom, I heard you built your own house." "Er, yeah. It's only small though." "You're underselling yourself again."

japanese: 今年度の入学式の前日に、昨年度入学式ができなかった新２年生の為の入学式をするなんて、粋な計らいだね。
english: Holding an extra entrance ceremony for second year students who weren't able to attend last academic year, what a stellar idea.

japanese: 俺たち、プロのカメラマンなんだ。
english: We're professional photographers.

japanese: その子はとても忙しいのよ。
english: The child is very busy.

japanese: 俺、肛門の専門家に診てもらわなきゃ。
english: I gotta go see a proctologist.

japanese: 人に意地悪して楽しい？
english: Do you enjoy being unkind to everyone?

japanese: とぼけないで。あなたのことよ。
english: Don't play dumb! You know it's you.

japanese: 兄ちゃんはね、私にすごく優しいの。
english: My big brother is really nice to me.

japanese: バトミントンとテニスはどう違うの？
english: What's the difference between badminton and tennis?

japanese: ドアの鍵は掛けないでおいてね。
english: Leave the door unlocked.

japanese: この教室は消しゴムの忘れ物が多い。
english: There are a lot of forgotten erasers in the classroom.

japanese: 「時間がなくてお昼ご飯準備できずに出てきちゃったけど、どうしてる？」「大丈夫だよ。パンにバターと蜂蜜付けて食べてるから」「なら良かった。もう少ししたら帰るね」
english: "I didn't have time to make lunch, I just left... but, how are you doing?" "I'm fine. I'm eating bread with some butter and honey. I'll be back in a little while."

japanese: 私はブラジル人のリカルドです。
english: My name's Ricardo and I'm Brazilian.
